isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-8609 SERIES - MAINTENANCE

svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to Figure 2 for the following items.

step1.para: Air System and Connections. Check for leaks, worn air lines, loose connections and bolts. Refer to AIR SYSTEM.
Clutch Housing Mounting. Check clutch housing bolts for looseness.

Clutch Release Bearing (Not Shown). Remove hand hole cover and check the radial and axial clearance of the release bearing. Check relative position of thrust surface of release bearing with thrust sleeve on push-type clutches.
Clutch Pedal Shaft and Bores. Pry upward on shafts to check wear. If excessive movement is found, remove the clutch release mechanism and check bushings in bores and wear on shafts.
Lubricant. Change at specified service intervals. Use only the types and grades as recommended in GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Fill and Drain Plugs. Remove fill plugs and check level of lubricant at specified intervals. Tighten fill and drain plugs securely.

Bolts and Gaskets. Check all bolts, especially those on PTO covers and rear bearing covers for looseness which would cause oil leakage. Refer to the TORQUE CHART. Check PTO opening and rear bearing covers for oil leakage due to a faulty gasket.
Gear Shift Lever. Check for looseness and free play in the housing. If the lever is loose in the housing, proceed with Step 9.

Gear Shift Lever Housing Assembly. Remove the air lines at the slave valve and remove the gear shift lever housing assembly from the transmission. Check the tension spring and washer for set and wear. Check the gear shift lever spade pin and slot for wear. Check the bottom end of the gear shift lever for wear and check the slot of yokes and blocks in the shifter housing for wear at contact points with the shift lever.
Universal Joint Companion Flange or Yoke Nut. Check for tightness. Tighten to recommended torque. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Output Shaft (Not Shown). Pry upward against the output shaft to check the radial clearance in the mainshaft rear bearing.

note.para: If necessary, use a solvent and shop rag to clean the sealing surface of the companion flange or yoke.

caution.para: Do not use crocus cloth, emery paper or other abrasive materials that will mar the surface finish.

step1.para: Splines on the Output Shaft (Not Shown). Check for wear from movement and chucking action of the universal joint companion flange or yoke.
Mainshaft Rear Bearing Cover. Check the oil seal for wear.
